intro: Galium brevifolium var. chium, commonly known as the short-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and features small, opposite leaves that are typically rounded or ovate. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its shorter leaves compared to the typical form of Galium brevifolium.
